intro: Narthecium americanum, commonly known as the American spring beauty, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodlands. It has a low-growing habit with hairy leaves and produces small, inconspicuous fruits. Narthecium americanum is often found in the northeastern United States and parts of Canada.
